alert.note: Alert for Esmeralda and Central Nye County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 28 at 3:14AM PST until December 30 at 10:00AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible with total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches above 3000 feet and of 2 to 6 inches above 6000 feet. * WHERE...In Nevada, Esmeralda and Central Nye County. In California, Owens Valley and Death Valley National Park. * WHEN...From early Wednesday morning through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and dangerous travel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The primary concern will be along Highway 395 in the Owens Valley and Highway 95 through southern Nye County where snow accumulations of a couple of inches on the roadway may result in dangerous travel conditions. Additional concerns surround the higher terrain of Death Valley National Park where inexperienced winter hikers could be caught off guard by snow accumulations exceeding 5 inches at the highest peaks.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
